bioghist.p: The Improved Order of Red Men is a Fraternal Organization established in Baltimore, Maryland, in 1834. Their rituals and regalia are modeled after those used by native people of North America. The order claims direct descent from the Sons of Liberty, noting that the Sons participated in the Boston Tea Party dressed as Native Americans. Their ladies' auxiliary is the Degree of Pocahontas. They sponsor two youth organizations, the Degree of Hiawatha for boys and the Degree of Anona for girls. At its height, in 1935, the organization claimed a membership of about half a million.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of four volumes from various tribes of the order. Three volumes are member registers, which list the names, occupations, and ages of new members. Member registers are for Baltimore [?], 1855-1867; the Penobscot Tribe #70, circa 1890; and Philadelphia, 1867-1891. The other volume in the collection is a receipt book for the Relief Committee of the Wingohocking Tribe #33 of Frankford, Pennsylvania, 1867-1870. Entries in this volume record the name of the member, date of the payment, and amount paid.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
